New Records: Josh Inglis scored the fastest ever hundred for Australia in men's T20Is, reaching three figures in just 43 balls.
Key Match Events: Josh Inglis' magnificent hundred helped Australia to a comfortable win over Scotland.
Brad Currie removed Travis Head for a first-ball duck and had Jake Fraser-McGurk well caught on the long-on boundary by Chris Sole.
Inglis and Cam Green added 92 for the third wicket.
Tim David's lusty blows saw Australia finish strongly.
George Munsey took 17 from the first over of the chase.
Brandon McMullen scored 59, featuring four fours and four sixes.
Marcus Stoinis took 4-23 and bowled 13 dot balls in his 3.4 overs.
Post-Match Reflections: Josh Inglis expressed that holding the record for the fastest hundred is really nice and emphasized the importance of building a partnership with Cam Green.
Inglis mentioned the opportunity to get game time and try to cement his spot in the team.
